intro: Piptocarpha venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan piptocarpha, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while its flowers are small and clustered in yellow or white heads. Piptocarpha venezuelensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
